channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Line bike left in the road another against the fence, 20th July
item.description:
Dangerous now

item.title: Many lights not working, 20th July
item.description:
Many light in the pedestrian tunnel aren’t working. Many are damaged and light bulbs are missing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sidcup By-pass, Longlands, London

item.title: Desk abandoned, 20th July
item.description:
Someone has flytipped a desk

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Vanbrugh Park Road West, East Greenwich, London

item.title: Fly tipping of household items at garage doors on Sidney Road, N22, 20th July
item.description:
Opposite 58 Sidney Road, two double black garage doors. A clothing rack, black folding table, bucket with tools in. I wish people would stop dumping their junk here

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 59, Sidney Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large amount of fly tipping, 20th July
item.description:
This rubbish (clothes, large wooden structure that is deteriorating) and fridge have been fly tipped here for several weeks now and been added to. It is now blocking the street and causing a hazard

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodland Grove, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two dumped vehicles with no registration marks. Also piles of rubbish, 20th July
item.description:
On this site off Meadowview Road which is just within the London Borough of Bromley, two dumped vehicles with no registration marks. Also piles of rubbish. All have clearly been there a very long time. The Borough boundary runs down the middle of the road and this site is not private land but highway verge land. It not the responsibility of LB Lewisham.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Meadowview Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 8 bicycles chained to public railing with for sale sign, 20th July
item.description:
The person living at 4 edge hill who is a hoarder has now started chaining up bicycles to the public railing with a big for sale sign, and is adding more bicycles every week. something must be done about this person they are a nuisance to the local community.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 57, Plumstead Common Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Someone has dumped a fridge at the bottom of our road, 20th July
item.description:
It’s an absolute disgrace from whoever has done it. I know it’s not your fault but I’d like it moved please

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Majendie Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 7 vehicles for one house taking up whole street, 20th July
item.description:
The person at number 4 edge hill has at least 7 vehicles, they are a hoarder and the vehicles are all covered in items, they are not legally driveable, and they stop anyone else parking on the road. it is an eyesore and a health hazard. they also chain up bikes to the public railuings opposite and have for sale sign on the bicycles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Edge Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Asbestos tank and paint cans, 20th July
item.description:
Been here for over a week and reported on 17th already, but still here! Kids playing right next to this all the time and it’s a dangerous substance!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hafton Road, Catford South, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overflowing bin, 20th July
item.description:
Again people jst leaving their s*** in this corner

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Powerscroft Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: URGENT! Oxford Road EN3 outside no 1. A very deep and dangerous pothole, 20th July
item.description:
This pothole has been here for many months. I have reported this before. One foot long and several inches deep. The carriageway is breaking up around the margins. I ride a bicycle and can tell you that this hole could cause a very serious accident if a cyclist hits it. Danger to life please repair with all due haste.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oxford Road, Southbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Filth, 20th July
item.description:
Opened bin bag again, all sorts of filth obstructing the side road

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Powerscroft Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Northfield Road EN3 Southern kerb between Chester Gardens and Norfolk Road Litter, litter, litter, 20th July
item.description:
This section of pavement is strewn with litter and needs sweeping. Litter begets litter. The more litter there is the more litter there will be. Please get this cleared as it makes the whole area look unkempt and encourages other anti social behaviour.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, Northfield Road, Ponders End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large quantity of domestic waste dumped on pavement, 20th July
item.description:
Northfield Road EN3 opposite Chester Gardens next to the BT junction box. Many bags of assorted domestic detritus. Includes rotting kitchen waste. Please clear urgently and arrange for street sweeper to clear the remaining debrus
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, Northfield Road, Ponders End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Homeless Person lives in the bin store, 20th July
item.description:
A Homeless person has moved into the bin stores in front of the block of flats. They’ve been living there for a few weeks now. I’m very concerned for their wellbeing and for the safety issues this brings to us as tenants.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brenthouse Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vandalism. Youths., 20th July
item.description:
The park hut is not secure. Youths travel to this location and try and brake into the main door. The side doors and smashed in. It is coursing youths to meet here to try and smash in. Please board it up properly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stanhope Grove, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road sign on St John’s st leaning dangerously, 20th July
item.description:
Road sign on St John’s street near Owen street is leaning dangerously. Looks unstable and like it may fall over & the sign itself is loose and could hit pedestrians.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 412-416, St. John Street, Islington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly Tipping, 20th July
item.description:
Covering the pavement near the entrance of the park. The loose rubbish fly all around the street and sharp objects lying around.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wenlock Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bikes going through red light, 20th July
item.description:
Nearly hit by a lady on a Lime bike who went sailing through a red light and when the green man to cross was showing. Another bike that went through red light only a minute earlier from another direction nearly hit a car that was turning onto green lanes and that had right of way. Bikes are regularly going through red lights at this junction and it’s rare that you can cross without having a near miss with one.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Collins Road, Highbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet
